definition: to wait for (orders, a decision, a judgment)
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
to wait/to inquire after/to watch/season/climate/(old) period of five days

sentences.english: I'm at your disposal the whole morning.
sentences.chinese: 整個上午我聽候你的吩咐。

sentences.english: He confessed his crime, and cast himself on the mercy of the court.
sentences.chinese: 他坦白了他的罪行，聽候法院處理。

sentences.english: I'll always be at your command, darling.
sentences.chinese: 親愛的，我將永遠聽候你的差遺。

sentences.english: The suspect was marched to the police station for interrogation .
sentences.chinese: 嫌疑犯被押赴警察局聽候訊問。

sentences.english: The suspect is marched to the police station for interrogation.
sentences.chinese: 嫌疑犯被押赴警察局聽候訊問。

sentences.english: After independence we would no longer be at the beck and call of the colonial master.
sentences.chinese: 獨立之後我們將不再聽候殖民宗主國的吆喝和指使。

sentences.english: You make me what I am, evil at your command.
sentences.chinese: 你使我成爲這個模樣，邪惡聽候你的支配。
